Subjective: Palpitations; Shortness of breath; Rapid breathing; Muscle tension; Fatigue; Sleep disturbance (6 hours/night); Symptoms worsened over 2 weeks. No chest pain; No dizziness; No irregular heartbeat; No abdominal complaints. Works full-time as a doctor in internal medicine; No smoking/alcohol. Request: Rule out somatic causes (e.g., anemia); Wants to discuss with practice nurse.
Objective: BP 120/60; HR 65; RR 14; SpO2 98%. Normal heart and lung exam; No murmurs or abnormalities.
Assessment: Stress-related symptoms, likely anxiety. No somatic cause identified on exam. Ruled out: Anemia, thyroid dysfunction, other somatic causes.
Plan: Order blood tests (Hgb, TSH, LFTs, KFTs)
Refer to mental health nurse for stress management
Recommend relaxation techniques: coffee breaks, social calls, exercise
Advise regular sleep schedule and work-life balance
Suggest occupational health consultation for workload adjustment
Follow-up as needed; patient can return if symptoms worsen
